summary: Carnegie Mellon University, a private institution in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is highly selective with an acceptance rate of 11.5%. For the 2025-2026 academic year, the annual tuition is $67,020, with the total cost of attendance estimated at approximately $90,070. Known for its strong focus on technology and the arts, some of its most popular and top-ranked programs include Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Robotics, and Drama. The university offers a test-optional admissions policy and a holistic review process.

undergraduate.sat_range: Test-optional; recommended scores 1460-1560 for submitted SAT
undergraduate.act_range: Test-optional; recommended scores 33-35 for submitted ACT
undergraduate.essays_required: Yes, Common Application essay and Carnegie Mellon supplemental essays
undergraduate.letters_of_recommendation: One to three letters required, depending on program
undergraduate.supplemental_materials: Required for some programs (e.g., portfolios for arts and design)

deadlines.early_action: Early Decision I: 2025-11-01, Early Decision II: 2025-01-03

costs.financial_aid_available: Yes, need-based financial aid and scholarships available; CMU Pathway Program for low-income students

required_courses: Four years of mathematics including calculus
Three to four years of science with labs
recommended_courses: Advanced Placement (AP), IB, or honors-level courses
Additional STEM courses for engineering and computer science applicants
admission_requirements.extracurricular_importance: Highly important; demonstrated leadership, creativity, and unique achievements are strongly considered

student_life.dining_options: Multiple dining halls, cafes, and meal plans available

special_features: Test-optional admissions policy with emphasis on holistic review
Strong interdisciplinary programs integrating arts and technology
Notable programs in computer science and drama
Pathway Program providing tuition-free education for low-income U.S. students
